title: Vietnam's largest warship starts patrolling Nansha
description: Truong Sa HQ-571, Vietnam’s largest transport warship, was recently reported to be patrolling the Nansha Islands and sailing towards the Nanwei Island, most representative island of the Nansha Islands, in the South China Sea.
cleanContent:
(Photo/huanqiu.com)

(Photo/huanqiu.com)

(Photo/huanqiu.com)

(Photo/huanqiu.com)

By Zhao Wei, Sina EnglishTruong Sa HQ-571, Vietnam’s largest transport warship, was recently reported to be patrolling the Nansha Islands and sailing towards the Nanwei Island, most representative island of the Nansha Islands, in the South China Sea.The 71- meter long, 13.2- meter wide Truong Sa warship is known as Vietnam's largest home-made transport warship, with the top speed of 16 nautical mile and voyage duration for a maximum of 40 days. “Truong Sa”, the name of the warship, is what the Vietnam call the Nansha Islands.Related news: | |
